td.content: Care Co-ordinator
Role

text.paragraph: Does the individual agree the content of this care plan? Yes
Does the individual have a copy of this care plan? Yes

paragraph.content: Ms Walters sustained a hip fracture and a fractured shoulder 6 months ago following a road traffic accident and has not made a full recovery. She is having difficulties with mobilising and carrying out personal care and dressing tasks. Personal care is being provided and rehab services to help Ms Walters to improve ADLs and mobility, with a review planned in 8 weeks.
Independence with personal care activities and mobility

th.content: Identified Risks and Needs from the Assessment
What are we trying to achieve?

td.content: Is having difficulties with carrying out personal care and dressing tasks
Independence with personal care activities
Domiciliary support for personal care and dressing tasks for 8 weeks
Leigh Timpson, Social Worker, Hebburn Social Services
Helping Hands Domiciliary care agency
Daily morning call - carer to call for half an hour at 8.30am to assist with washing and dressing,Daily evening call- carer to call for half an hour at 9.30pm to assist with getting undressed
Information on private cleaning services to be provided
Is having difficulties with carrying out personal care and dressing tasks and with mobilising
Independence with personal care and dressing. Being able to go to visit her mother and go shopping
Re-enablement service to support with working on independence with daily living activities and improving mobility
Leigh Timpson, Social Worker, Hebburn Social Services
Home Rehab Service
Occupational Therapist to call 3 times /week Mon/Wed /Fri to support with enablement tasks. Physiotherapist to assess mobility issues.
Is having difficulties with mobilising
Being able to go to visit her mother and go shopping
Arrangements for accessible transport to be made. Family to continue to support with shopping tasks
Leigh Timpson, Social Worker, Hebburn Social Services
Dial-A-Ride

text.paragraph: In emergency in office hours, contact Leigh Timpson on 0208 321 1234. In emergency out of hours, contact the emergency duty team number 0208 321 1000

paragraph.content: Any Needs Being Met by Family and Friends?

text.paragraph: Ms Wallters recieves family support for some domestic tasks including shopping.
Ms Walters is quite deaf,but is able to lip read well, It is therefore recommended that people speak slowly and clearly whilst facing client
